thread.title: Redbox facts: 12 things you probably didn't know about the movie kiosk king
thread.title_full: Redbox facts: 12 things you probably didn't know about the movie kiosk king - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Redbox facts: 12 things you probably didn't know about the movie kiosk king
text:
Photo: John Greim, Getty Images Image 1 of / 13 13 According to a Redbox representative there are some 1,200 kiosks across the Houston area alone at nearly 900 locations. According to a Redbox representative there are some 1,200 kiosks across the Houston area alone at nearly 900 locations. Photo: John Greim, Getty Images Image 2 of 13 About 300 locations have two boxes to keep up with demand. Some rent out video game titles in addition to films.
Photo: Justin Sullivan, Getty Images Image 3 of 13 Redbox says that the most popular title in Houston since the service arrived here in 2005 has been 2012's “21 Jump Street” starring Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum. Redbox says that the most popular title in Houston since the service arrived here in 2005 has been 2012's “21 Jump Street” starring Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum. Photo: Handout Image 4 of 13 Redbox began life in 2004 with a test run in Denver. It was originally a venture set up within the McDonald’s company. In 2009 Coinstar, an Outerwall company, purchased the remaining stakes in Redbox for $208 million. Redbox began life in 2004 with a test run in Denver. It was originally a venture set up within the McDonald’s company. In 2009 Coinstar, an Outerwall company, purchased the remaining stakes in Redbox for ... more Photo: David Zalubowski, AP Image 5 of 13 The oldest kiosks in Houston are at McDonald’s locations off Cullen and off Wallisville Road. The oldest kiosks in Houston are at McDonald’s locations off Cullen and off Wallisville Road. Photo: Brandon Seidel, Getty Images/iStockphoto Image 6 of 13 Redbox says that it rents out more new release movies than any home entertainment provider combined. Redbox says that it rents out more new release movies than any home entertainment provider combined. Photo: Justin Sullivan, Getty Images Image 7 of 13 Just over 2,000 Redbox discs are rented out per minute, according to recent stats. Back in 2010 it was said that a new kiosk was opening at a rate of one per minute.
Photo: Justin Sullivan, Getty Images Image 8 of 13 There are 35,000 locations nationwide, so it’s actually hard to escape the machines. There are 35,000 locations nationwide, so it’s actually hard to escape the machines. Photo: Brian Kersey, FRE Image 9 of 13 Redbox says that two-thirds of Americans reside within five minutes of a kiosk. That beats out even Starbucks and McDonald's in terms of saturation. Redbox says that two-thirds of Americans reside within five minutes of a kiosk. That beats out even Starbucks and McDonald's in terms of saturation. Photo: Justin Sullivan, Getty Images Image 10 of 13 Netflix co-founder Rich Lowe served as president of Redbox until 2011. Netflix co-founder Rich Lowe served as president of Redbox until 2011. Photo: Justin Sullivan, Getty Images Image 11 of 13 The service left Canada earlier this year, citing low demand. The service left Canada earlier this year, citing low demand. Photo: HANDOUT, Knight Ridder Tribune Image 12 of 13 Right now Houstonians can’t get enough of “Avengers: Age Of Ultron,” which was a massive box-office hit earlier this year. Right now Houstonians can’t get enough of “Avengers: Age Of Ultron,” which was a massive box-office hit earlier this year. Photo: Jay Maidment, HONS Image 13 of 13 Redbox facts: 12 things you probably didn't know about the movie kiosk king 1 / 13 Back to Gallery Most of us have likely used a Redbox movie kiosk to rent a DVD or Blu-ray at some point in time.
The big red movie kiosks are seemingly everywhere, from McDonald’s locations, your local drug store, and sometimes even nestled inside Walmarts next to a soda machine.
According to a Redbox representative there are some 1,200 kiosks across the Houston area alone at nearly 900 locations. Some places have two boxes to keep up with demand. Some rent out video game titles in addition to films.
Redbox began life in 2004 with a test run in Denver. It was originally a venture set up within the McDonald’s company. In 2009 Coinstar purchased the remaining stakes in the company.
RELATED: Most Blockbusters to go dark
The oldest kiosks in Houston are at McDonald’s locations off Cullen and Wallisville Road.
There are 35,000 locations nationwide, so it’s actually hard to escape the machines. Redbox says that two-thirds of Americans reside within five minutes of a kiosk. That beats out even Starbucks in terms of saturation.
For some Redbox or Netflix are there main movie connections. Cheaper than a trip to the movie theater, of course, but the daily recurring rental fee can add up for movies forgotten on the coffee table
Redbox says that the most popular title in Houston since the service arrived here in 2005 has been “21 Jump Street” with Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum.
Right now Houstonians can’t get enough of “Avengers: Age Of Ultron,” which was a massive box-office hit earlier this year.
